climbs.name: Tidal Wave - PERMANENTLY CLOSED TO CLIMBING!!

content.description: The moves may seem hard to find from the bottom but once you get up on the wall the holds are all there. This is the funnest route on the wall and well worth the hike. The summit of this wall can be reached by scrambling up from these chains, be very careful getting back to the chains.
content.protection: A bolted route with bolted chain anchors. We used a large horn up top as an anchor to down climb back to the chains (if you summit).
content.location: This is the furthest right, bolted route on the wall.

climbs.name: Riding Giants - PERMANENTLY CLOSED TO CLIMBING!!

content.description:
Fun climbing up the chimney (5.3-ish) leads to the thin, steep face above.  Thin climbing, poorly protected with dubious thin cams up the steep face.  Take advantage of all potential gear placements.  Thin cams seem to work in some shallow cracks.

Near the top, theres a shallow pod feature with a corner crack which accepts larger cams (whew).

Take care.  This is a thin lead demanding a cool head and very honed gear placing skills.  A fall from above the chimney could have dire consequences (especially if your gear pulls).

That said, the climbing is fun and the rock pretty good.  Test all holds as this hasn't seen much if any traffic.  Go lightly and be solid.
content.protection: Standard rack to include a double set of small cams (00 TCU or equivalent).  No fixed gear and no summit anchor.
content.location: Located to the right of Tidal Wave.  Starts in the chimney and continues up the steep face above the chimney to the summit of the Tidal Wave wall.  Down lead to the anchor on Tidal Wave (take care!!) as there's no summit anchor.

climbs.name: Point Break - PERMANENTLY CLOSED TO CLIMBING!!

content.description: Tricky thin at the bottom.  Gets easier the higher you go.
content.protection: Bolt protected with fixed anchor on top.
content.location: Located just right of the shallow arete in the middle of routes at this crag.  Rappel route.

content.description: Start with a thin move near the bottom which leads to fun, steep jugs.
content.protection: Bolt protected.  Fixed anchor on top.
content.location: Located just left of the shallow arete (left of Point Break which is right of this arete).  Chain anchor.

climbs.name: Blue Crush - PERMANENTLY CLOSED TO CLIMBING!!

content.description: Thin start leads to shallow left facing crack which will readily accept your medium cam (.75 camalot or equivalent).  Milk this crack for pro and take advantage of holds either side.  Continue up, gettin' good protection with more cams until a step back right finishes at the KP 109 fixed anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack.  No fixed gear on route.  Use anchor on KP 109 at top of route.
content.location: Located just left of KP 109 and to the right of Big Kahuna.  Starts with a face move which gains the shallow left facing crack.  Rappel KP 109.

climbs.name: Big Kahuna - PERMANENTLY CLOSED TO CLIMBING!!

content.description: Step up, clip, then make an awkward and kinda tricky traverse to the left.  Fight the pump, find a clippin' jug, then head straight up.  Gets easier higher (thankfully).  Fun!
content.protection: Bolt protected sport climb.  Fixed anchor (chain) at top.
content.location: Left most route on the Tidal Wave wall.  Rappel route.
